courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Introduction to Molecular Biotechnology

meetings.instructor:
Professor CHAN Ho Yin Edwin, 
Professor CHOI Chung Hang Jonathan, 
Professor LAM Hon Ming, 
Professor WONG Kam Bo, 
Professor WONG Wing Tak Jack

Professor CHAN Ho Yin Edwin, 
Professor CHOI Chung Hang Jonathan, 
Professor LAM Hon Ming, 
Professor WONG Kam Bo, 
Professor WONG Wing Tak Jack

Professor CHAN Ho Yin Edwin, 
Professor CHOI Chung Hang Jonathan, 
Professor LAM Hon Ming, 
Professor WONG Kam Bo, 
Professor WONG Wing Tak Jack

courses.description: The aim of this course is to introduce the basic principles and current topics in molecular biotechnology. The course will first cover major discoveries for the advancement of molecular biotechnology, basic principles of gene expression and recombinant DNA technology. Then, selected topics in molecular biotechnology such as human genome project, microbial, plant, animal and medical biotechnology will be introduced.
courses.learning_outcomes:
- to grasp an overview of the principles and various aspects of molecular biotechnology

- to be able to find materials on topics of molecular biotechnology

- to enhance the presentation and discussion skills
courses.course_syllabus:
Introduction and overviews of the following topics in biotechnology:

1. Microbial biotechnology

2. Plant biotechnology

3. Animal biotechnology

4. Marine biotechnology

5. Environmental biotechnology

6. Applied immunology

7. Gene therapy

8. Social impacts of biotechnology

Students are required to select a topics in molecular biotechnology, and present a poster.
courses.feedback_evaluation:
Course Questionnaire

Reflection of teachers

Qualitative feedback from student panels
courses.recommended_readings: Glick & Pasternak “Molecular Biotechnology: Principles and Applications of Recombinant DNA”

courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Diversity of Life: Applications and Sustainability

meetings.instructor:
Dr. CHIU Siu Wai, 
Professor HUI Jerome Ho Lam, 
Professor LAM Hon Ming, 
Professor TSUI Tsz Ki Martin

Dr. CHIU Siu Wai, 
Professor HUI Jerome Ho Lam, 
Professor LAM Hon Ming, 
Professor TSUI Tsz Ki Martin

Dr. CHIU Siu Wai, 
Professor HUI Jerome Ho Lam, 
Professor LAM Hon Ming, 
Professor TSUI Tsz Ki Martin

courses.description: The course is designed to train students to acquire an overall view on the diversity of living organisms, with emphasis on their potential applications and sustainable survival. The concepts of phylogeny and evolution will be used to explain how the living organisms diversify along the time line. Selected examples from major groups of living organisms will be chosen to discuss: (i) how to make proper use of these biological resources in important issues of human society such as health, agriculture, environment, and energy; and (ii) how they adapt and survive in a particular environment and the challenges that affecting their sustainable existence
courses.course_syllabus:
• Introduction: the Concepts of Phylogeny, Evolution, and Speciation

• Eubacteria and Archebacteria: Impacts on Health and Biotechnology

• Protists: the Dawn of the Eukarya, an Important Milestone in Evolution

• Plants: Adaptation from Aquatic to Terrestrial Habitat; Important sources of Food and Medicine

• Fungi: Recyclers, Killers, and Plant Partners in Nature

• Animal: Diversified Body Plan; the Commonality and Complexity of Animal Development

• Human and Viruses: How Human Evolved; the Interactions between Hosts and Viruses

• Field Trip: Relationship Between Living Organisms and the Environment; Concepts of Sustainability

• 導論: 系統發生、演化和物種形成的概念

• 細菌與古細菌: 對醫藥及生物科技的影響

• 原生生物: 全核生物的黎明, 演化中的一個重要里程

• 植物: 從水生到陸上棲息地的適應; 食物和醫藥的重要來源
• 真菌: 自然界中的循環再生者、殺手和植物夥伴

• 動物: 多元化的身體結構; 動物演化中的共通性和複雜性
• 人類與病毒: 人類的演化; 寄主與病毒的相互作用
• 野外考察: 生物與環境的關係; 可持續發展的概念
courses.feedback_evaluation:
•Course questionnaire will be conduced every time when the course is run.

•Qualitative feedback from the student panels will be sought, via formal staff-student consultation committee meetings or informal interactions between teachers and students.

•If a problem is spotted, teachers will give their reflections, including evidence from the assessment.

•本科每課都設有課程調查問卷。
•通過正式的師生諮詢委員會會議或非正式師生互動獲得學生對課程的反饋。
•如出現爭議，本科教授會作出檢示（包括從評估得到的依據）。
courses.recommended_readings:
“Biology” by Peter H. Raven and George B. Johnson. McGraw-Hill Companies, Inc.

“Life: The Science of Biology” by William K. Purves, Gordon H. Orians, David E. Sadava, Craig Heller. W. H. Freeman Publishers.

courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Business and Social Aspects of Biotechnology

meetings.instructor:
Dr. YEUNG Shu Ying, 
Professor CHAN Albert Wai Kit, 
Professor HO Kwok Keung Walter, 
Professor SHAW Pang Chui, 
Professor WONG Wing Tak Jack

Dr. YEUNG Shu Ying, 
Professor CHAN Albert Wai Kit, 
Professor HO Kwok Keung Walter, 
Professor SHAW Pang Chui, 
Professor WONG Wing Tak Jack

courses.description: This course addresses the business and social issues related to the use of modern biotechnology. Topics include business development in the industry, operations in running a bio-business, manufacturing practice, drug development process, regulation and policy, intellectual property issues, environmental aspects of biotechnology, ethical and public concerns.
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. Be able to give an intelligent account of what the biotechnology industry is.

2. Understand the interrelationship between science and business development of the biotechnology industry.

3. The impact of science on future directions of biotechnology.

4. Have a firm grasp on various aspects in starting a biotechnology business including fund raising, financing, product development and manufacturing.

5. Understand the legal requirements as applied to the biotechnology industry including contracts, agreements, IPR and patents.

6. Be aware of the social impact of biotechnology.

7. Build up skill and confidence in making decision on biotechnology investment.

通过本课程的学习，学生可以掌握如下技能：
1. 对什么是生物技术相关工业有一个明辨的能力；

2. 理解科学及其商务运作与生物技术工业领域之间的相辅相成关系；

3. 了解科学进步对生物技术未来发展方向的影响；

4. 牢固掌握运作生物技术企业的各方面因素，包括项目资金筹备，财务管理，产品研发和批量生产等；

5. 了解生物技术公司的各类法规规范，比如合同和协议制订，知识产权保护以及专利申请等；

6. 关注生物科技公司对社会的影响；

7. 通过扎实的知识储备树立信心，为生物技术行业的投资决策奠定基础。
courses.course_syllabus:
Definition and scope of biotechnology.

Review of biotechnology developments leading to the formation of the industry

Major discoveries/products, major companies, market capitalization, national comparisons

Recent development of Biotechnology in Hong Kong and Asia

Technology Transfer primer-various form of transfer, key terms in an agreement, patent application strategy

Case Studies on R&D and Business decision: Legal aspects of biotechnology business Protection of intellectual property rights in biotechnology research and patent application. Material Transfer Agreement, IPO and Business Report

Moral and ethical issues of genetic engineering and cloning

Drug development and regulatory requirements (New Drug Application, NDA)

Group discussion and presentation

生物技术的定义与范围。
生物技术发展促进生物工业形成之概述
各重大发现/产品、大型生物技术公司、市场资本和国家之间的比较

香港以及亚洲生物技术的近期发展
技术转让指引----转让形式、协议中关键条款、申请专利策略

研发和商业决策的案例分析：生物技术企业面临的法律问题
生物技术研究和专利申请中的知识产权保护：转让协议、首次公开招股、商业报告基因工程与克隆面临的伦理道德问题药物开发与监管（新药申请）小组讨论及汇报
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Student engagement questionnaire specific for skills acquired in the course.

2. External examiner report.

3. Graduate survey.

1. 通过学生问卷了解其对本课程的教学目标需求。

2. 外审报告。

3. 毕业调查。
courses.required_readings:
1. Annual report of biotechnology industry issued by Biotechnology Industrial Organization (BIO).

2. Annual report of biotechnology industry issued by Ernst and Young.

3. Biotechnology Demystifying the Concepts by Bourgaize, Jewell and Busiser, Addision.

4. Made by Hong Kong, MIT press.

5. Case studies to be decided from year to year.

courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Medical Biotechnology

meetings.instructor:
Dr. SIOW Lam, 
Professor CHAN Ting Fung Philos

Dr. SIOW Lam, 
Professor CHAN Ting Fung Philos

courses.description: The field of medical biotechnology is experiencing rapid growth in recent years, leading to the development of innovative techniques for diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of diseases. With the basis in gene manipulation and cell culture, innovations in biomolecular therapies such as recombinant proteins, monoclonal antibodies, vaccines, nucleic acid therapies, and regenerative medicines are developed. These significantly improve human health. The course is designed to give students an insight into the principles and techniques leading to the innovations of therapeutics and molecular diagnostics. Safety and ethical issues will also be discussed.
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. Describe the basic principles and techniques of medical biotechnology.
2. Understand the mechanisms whereby the therapeutic molecules and diagnostic tools work.
3. Evaluate the use of medical biotechnology towards the modern society.
4. Appreciate the range of therapeutic molecules and diagnostic tools developed by the biotechnology industry over the last few years.
5. Realize the potential safety and ethical issues on these technologies on human health.

1. 描述医学生物技术的基本原理和技术。
2. 了解治疗性分子和诊断工具的运作机制。
3. 评估医疗生物技术在现代社会中的应用。
4. 意识到过去几年生物技术行业开发的治疗性分子和诊断工具。
5. 了解这些人类健康技术的潜在安全和道德问题。
courses.course_syllabus:
Topics include: 1) History of Medical Biotechnology; 2) High-throughput technologies in molecular diagnosis I and II;
3) Clinical sequencing in infectious disease control; 4) Clinical sequencing and precision medicine; 5) Protein therapeutics (pharmaceuticals, recombinant antibodies and enzymes); 6) Nucleic acids therapeutic agents and gene therapy; 7) Current vaccine design; 8) Stem cells and regenerative medicine; 9) Nanoparticles in medicine.

題目包括: 1) 醫學生物技術史; 2) 高通量技術分子診斷; 3)傳染病控制的臨床測序; 4) 臨床測序和精準醫學; 5) 蛋白質療法 (藥物、重組抗體和酶); 6) 核酸治療媒介和基因治療; 7) 當前的疫苗設計; 8) 幹細胞和再生醫學; 9) 納米粒子醫學

题目包括: 1) 医学生物技术史; 2) 高通量技术分子诊断; 3)传染病控制的临床测序; 4) 临床测序和精准医学; 5) 蛋白质疗法(药物，重组抗体和酶); 6 ) 核酸治疗媒介和基因治疗; 7) 当前的疫苗设计; 8) 干细胞和再生医学; 9) 纳米粒子医学
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Feedback from course evaluation.
2. Qualitative feedback from the students will be sought, via formal staff-student consultation committee meetings.
courses.required_readings: n/a
courses.recommended_readings: Glick, Bernard R ; Patten, Cheryl L ; Delovitch, T. L (2014) Medical Biotechnology, Washington, DC: ASM Press.

courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Industrial applications of plant genetic modification

meetings.instructor:
Professor KANG Byung Ho, 
Professor ZHONG Silin

Professor KANG Byung Ho, 
Professor ZHONG Silin

courses.description: This course is to prepare students with interests in higher-level molecular biology-based plant biotechnology. Students enrolled in this course will study the application of transgenic plants in agriculture and environmental conservation. This course also explores modern advances in engineering plant cells to produce pharmaceuticals, environment-friendly biomaterials, or biofuels. A problem-based pedagogic approach is employed to enhance students’ understanding of issues, technical developments, and commercial applications in plant biotechnology
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken MBTE4510.
courses.course_syllabus:
General principle of transgenic technology

Industrial prospective of plant biotechnology

Safety issues of transgenic technology
courses.feedback_evaluation:
* Course questionnaire will be conduced every time when the course is run.
* Qualitative feedback from the student panels will be sought, via formal staff-student consultation committee meetings or informal interactions between teachers and students.
* If a problem is spotted, teachers will give their reflections, including evidence from the assessment.
courses.required_readings: “Plant Biotechnology” by A. Slater, N. Scott and M. Fowler (2008)
courses.recommended_readings:
“Plants, Genes, and Crop Biotechnology” by M. Chrispeels and D.E. Sadava (2002)

“Plant and Society” by E. Levetin and K. McMahon (2007)

“Gene IX” by B. Lewin (or the latest edition)

www.isaaa.org

courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Project in Medical Biotechnology

meetings.instructor:
Professor CHAN Ting Fung Philos, 
Professor WONG Wing Tak Jack

courses.description: The overall objective of this course is to help students to acquire an understanding of the companies and industries related to medical biotechnology in Hong Kong. Students will form groups (4-5 persons in a group) to prepare presentations on selected medical biotechnology companies so that they will be motivated by how these companies are running and the significance of their business in contributing to the society. They will choose and work on the subjects of their interests, and involve discussions with the supervisor. To fulfill the course requirements, students are required to carry out research through readings and/or surveys, and learn how to collect and analyze data, discuss their progress with their supervisors on a regular basis; submit a project report and give oral presentations.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Co-requisite: MBTE3510.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students taking this course are expected to achieve the followings:

1) To acquire an understanding on how the medical biotechnology companies are running and the significance of their business in contributing to the society.

2) To have improved skills in scientific writing.

3) To have improved capability in communication, team work and presentation
courses.course_syllabus: n/a
courses.feedback_evaluation: Direct feedback from students to teachers
courses.required_readings: Guided by supervisors
courses.recommended_readings: Suggested by supervisors

courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Transgenic Technologies in Animals and their Applications
courses.description: This course will cover the developments and applications of transgenic animals, including Drosophila, C. elegans, fish, mice, cattle, sheep and pigs. Relevant topics concerning human genome variations & genetic diseases and antibody technologies will also be covered.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken MBTE4520.
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. Recognize the values and impact of animal biosciences in modern biotechnology.

2. Recognize the basics of various transgenic technologies.

3. Demonstrate an awareness of the uniqueness and distinctive features of individual transgenic animal systems.

4. Recognize the pros and cons of individual animal systems in terms of biotechnology applications.

5. Describe various applications of animal biotechnology that can be utilized to improve quality of living of humans.
courses.course_syllabus:
1. Fundamental transgenic techniques

2. Transgenic animals: invertebrate

3. Transgenic animals: vertebrates

4. Antibody technologies

5. Human genome variations, monogenic diseases and animal models of human diseases
courses.feedback_evaluation: Course evaluation at the end of the course
courses.required_readings: n/a
courses.recommended_readings: Ramadass, P. (2017) Animal Biotechnology: Recent Concepts and Developments. Mjp Publishers

courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Project in Transgenic technologies in Animals and their Applications
courses.description: Group projects will be conducted by students to evaluate experimental systems that are related to animal biotechnology, through which students will be inspired by how the animal biotechnology can be applied for the advancement of scientific investigation and improve the quality of life of mankind. In this course, students will form groups to carry out independent research projects. They will choose and work on the subjects of their interest, and involve discussions with the supervisor. To fulfill the course requirements, students are required to discuss their progress with their supervisors on a regular basis; submit a project report and give oral presentations.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken MBTE4520. Co-requisite: MBTE3521.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students taking this course are expected to achieve the followings:

1) To better understand and appreciate the latest development of animal biotechnology, and how it can contribute to the advancement of scientific research and for the betterment of human health.

2) To have improved skills in scientific writing

3) To have enhanced capability of oral communication

參加本課程的學生應達到以下目標：

1) 了解動物生物技術的最新發展，以及它如何加速科研進程和促進人類健康。

2) 提升科學寫作技巧

3) 提升演講及口頭答辯技巧
courses.course_syllabus: n/a
courses.feedback_evaluation: Direct feedback from students to teachers
courses.required_readings: Guided by supervisors
courses.recommended_readings: Suggested by supervisors

courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Microbes and Bioremediation
courses.description: This course introduces the concept of microbial ecology and basic principles of chemical and biological degradation of toxic chemicals in the environment and familiarizes students with the application of latest microbial biotechnologies in identifying and handling toxic organic chemicals in natural environments. The occurrence and ecological significance of toxic organic chemicals, chemistry of contaminants and current technologies for biocatalysis, biodegradation and bioremediation of contaminated soils and water will be discussed.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken MBTE4530.
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. Critical thinking in understanding of a balanced microbial ecosystem
2. Learn and aware of the latest microbial technology in biocatalysis, biodegradation and bioremediation
3. Understand the trends and application of green products
4. Able to perform independent research and evaluation on assigned bioremediation projects

1. 認真理解微生物生態系統的平衡

2. 學習和了解生物催化、生物降解和生物修復方面的最新微生物技術

3. 了解綠色產品的趨勢和應用

4. 能夠對指定的生物修復項目進行獨立研究和評估
courses.course_syllabus:
1. microbial ecosystem
2. microbial technology in biocatalysis, biodegradation and bioremediation
3. greenproducts
4. bioremediation projects
courses.feedback_evaluation:
· Course Questionnaire

· Reflection of teachers

· Qualitative feedback from student panels

• 課程問卷

• 教師評估

• 學生小組的反饋

Text Book

Microbial Biotechnology, Fundamentals of Applied Microbiology 2nd Edition (2007), Alexander N. Glazer & Hiroshi Nikaido, Cambridge University Press
courses.recommended_readings:
Fundamentals of Applied Microbiology

Understanding Biotechnology (2003), Aluizio Borem, Fabricio R. Santos and David E Bowen Prentice Hall, Pearson Education Inc.

Understanding Biotechnology An Integrated and Cyber-based Approach (2003), George Acquaah Prentice Hall, Pearson Education Inc.

courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Biotechnology for Environment and Sustainability

meetings.instructor:
Dr. CHIU Siu Wai, 
Professor HUI Jerome Ho Lam, 
Professor LAM Hon Ming, 
Professor TSUI Tsz Ki Martin

courses.description: The greatest threats to human in the 21st century are the global environmental problems such as chemical pollution, global warming, depletion of natural resources, waste disposal, deforestation and loss of biodiversity. All of these are due to the use of natural resources in unsustainable manner in human’s activities. Environmental Biotechnology utilizing the biochemical potential of microorganisms and plants for the preservation and restoration of the environment can promote sustainable and efficient use of natural resources that can mitigate the environmental issues and improve human’s living. The course aims to introduce the principles and applications of environmental biotechnology for a sustainable future.
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. Recognize various global environmental concerns and the impact of these on various forms of life.

2. Recognize different types of environmental pollution and their impacts.

3. Demonstrate an awareness of emerging concerns such as climate change, waste management or reductions in fossil fuels, and new technologies for addressing these.

4. Describe various applications of environmental biotechnology that can alleviate the environmental concerns, and can provide sustainable development and better quality of living of human.

5. Various fields including chemistry, biochemistry, molecular biology and/or microbiology, in understanding and addressing the above issues, as well as exploring environmental resources for new technologies.

1. 認識到各種全球環境問題及其對各種生命形體型的影響。

2. 認識不同類型的環境污染及其影響。

3. 表現出對新出現的問題的認識，例如氣候變化、廢物管理或化石燃料的減少，以及解決這些問題的新技術。

4. 描述環境生物技術的各種應用，可以緩解環境問題，並可以提供可持續發展和更好的人類生活質量。

5. 化學、生物化學、分子生物學和/或微生物學等各個領域，了解和解決上述問題，以及為新技術探索環境資源。
courses.course_syllabus:
1. Introduction to Environmental Biotechnology: for sustainable future
2. Carbon footprint, water-use and air quality
3. Bioaccumulation, biodegradation and Bioremediation
4. Marine pollution and biosensors
5. Renewable energy and bioreactor

1. 環境生物技術導論：可持續的未來

2. 碳足跡、用水和空氣質量

3. 生物積累、生物降解和生物修復

4. 海洋污染與生物感測器

5. 可再生能源和生物反應器
courses.feedback_evaluation:
Course evaluation at the end of the course

課程末之課檢評估
courses.required_readings: n/a
courses.recommended_readings:
Singh, Ram Lakhan (2016) Principles and Applications of Environmental Biotechnology for a Sustainable Future. Singapore: Springer Singapore Pte. Limited

courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Protein Engineering and Drug Design
courses.description: This course aims to introduce the basic concepts of the design of drugs and engineering of therapeutic proteins for treatment of human diseases. Students will be introduced to the processes of drug discovery and have an overview of drugs and their actions. Reinforced by case studies, students will learn the strategies to improve therapeutic proteins and to design drug rationally.
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. To understand the basic concepts and processes of drug discovery
2. To understand typical examples of drugs and their actions
3. To understand two strategies, namely rational design and directed evolution, to engineer a protein
4. To learn how to apply protein engineering to improve a therapeutic protein through case studies
5. To understand the strategies in rational drug design through case studies.

1. 了解藥物發現的基本概念和過程

2. 了解藥物的典型例子及其作用

3. 了解蛋白質工程“理性設計”和“定向進化” 的兩種策略

4. 通過案例學習如何應用蛋白質工程來改進治療性蛋白質

5. 通過案例研究了解理性設計藥物的策略。
courses.course_syllabus:
1. Introduction to drug discovery
2. Typical examples of drugs and their actions
3. Strategy of protein engineering: Rational design and Directed Evolution
4. Improving insulin – a case study of protein engineering
5. Rational design of drugs

1. 藥物發現簡介

2. 藥物及其作用的典型例子

3. 蛋白質工程策略：“理性設計”與“定向進化”

4. 改善胰島素—蛋白質工程案例研究

5. 藥物的理性設計
courses.feedback_evaluation:
Course evaluation at the end of the course

課程末之課檢評估
courses.required_readings: n/a
courses.recommended_readings:
Gary Walsh (2014) Proteins: Biochemistry and Biotechnology. John Wiley & Son

Kristian Stromgaard, Povl Krogsgaard-Larsen, and Ulf Madsen (2016) Textbook of Drug Design and Discovery, 5th Edition, Taylor & Francis Group.

courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Project in Protein Engineering and Drug Design

meetings.instructor:
Professor AU Wing Ngor Shannon, 
Professor NGO Chi Ki Jacky, 
Professor WONG Kam Bo

courses.description: Students will form groups to carry out an independent research project on how a drug or therapeutic protein is designed or engineered. They will evaluate the success or failure of such design or engineering. To fulfill the course requirements, students are required to discuss their progress with their supervisors regularly; submit a project report and give oral presentations.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Co-requisite: MBTE3560.
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. To understand how a drug or therapeutic protein is designed or engineered
2. To learn the ability to critically evaluate the success or failure of the drug or the engineered protein.
3. To increase skills in scientific communications.

1. 了解如何設計或改造藥物或治療性蛋白質。

2. 學習能批判地評估藥物設計或蛋白工程的成敗。

3. 提高科學的溝通技巧。
courses.course_syllabus: n/a
courses.feedback_evaluation:
Direct feedback from students to teachers

學生對教師的直接反饋
courses.required_readings: Guided by supervisor.
courses.recommended_readings: suggested by supervisor

courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Methods in Molecular Biotechnology Laboratory I
courses.description: This laboratory course will provide hands-on experience to students in widely used techniques in molecular biotechnology, including gene cloning and protein expression analysis.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken BCHE3650, CMBI3010 or SBMS2105.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students will learn the basic concepts and techniques of: 1) DNA cloning and analysis; 2) protein expression, western blotting and immunodetection. These provide useful hands-on experience for their future research work.
學生於本實驗科目將會學到以下的基礎概念和技術: 1) 去氧核糖核酸克隆和分折技術；2) 蛋白質表達，蛋白質印跡法和免疫檢測。所學技術對日後的研究工作將會很有幫助。
courses.course_syllabus: 1) Recombinant DNA and molecular cloning techniques: preparation of insert and vector for cloning; ligation and transformation; mini-preparation of plasmid DNA and OD measurement; screening of positive clone by PCR and restriction digestion; automated DNA sequencing. 2) Gene product analysis: protein extraction; separation of proteins by SDS-PAGE; western blotting and immunodection. 1) 重組去氧核糖核酸及分子克隆技術：制備克隆用的插入片段及載體；接合反應及轉化；質粒的微製備及量度吸光度；用聚合酶鏈反應及酶切來篩選陽性克隆；自動化核酸排序。2) 基因產物分析；蛋白質提取；用聚丙烯醯胺凝膠電泳來分離蛋白；蛋白質印跡法；免疫檢測。
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1) Course evaluation at the end of the course
2) Direct feedback from students to instructor and demonstrators
1) 學期末之課檢評估
2) 同學直接向老師及助教作即時反映
courses.required_readings: n.a.
courses.recommended_readings:
Sambrook, J. and Russell, D.W. (2001). Molecular cloning: A laboratory manual, 3rd Ed. Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory, Cold Spring Harbor, New York.

Towbin, H., Staehelin, T., and Gordon, J. (1979) Electrophoretic Transfer of proteins from polyacrylamide gels to nitrocellulose sheets: procedure and some applications. Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. USA 76: 4350-4354.

courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Methods in Molecular Biotechnology Lab II
courses.description: This laboratory provides hand-on experience of plant and animal biotechnology, including basic techniques to generate transgenic plant, and animal cell culture and its applications.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken CMBI3010. Pre-requisite: MBTE4033 or LSCI2002.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students will learn the basic concepts and techniques of: 1) cell culture; 2) transgenic techniques (transient and stable gene expression); 3) cell viability assay; 4) fluorescence microscopy. These techniques are very important and useful for their future studies and research careers.
學生於本實驗科目將會學到以下的基礎概念和技術: 1) 細胞培養；2) 基因轉化技術 (基因的瞬時及穩定表達)；3) 細胞存活檢測; 4) 螢光顯微鏡觀察。以上技術對學生以後的學習及研究生涯將會很有幫助。
courses.course_syllabus:
Generation of transgenic plant. Basic animal cell culture techniques. Cell viability assay. Transfection of animal cell. Fluorescent microscopy.
製造轉基因的植物。動物細胞培養的基本技術。細胞存活檢測。動物細胞的轉染。熒光顯微鏡觀察
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1) Course evaluation at the end of the course
2) Direct feedback from students to instructor and demonstrators
1)學期末之課檢評估
2)同學直接向老師及助教作即時反映
courses.required_readings: n/a
courses.recommended_readings:
Sambrook J and Russell D (2001) Molecular cloning: A laboratory manual, 3rd Ed. Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory, Cold Spring Harbor, New York.

Sanford J, Klein TM, Wolf ED and Allen N (1987) Delivery of substances into cells and tissues using a particle bombardment process. Particulate Science and Technology 5: 27-37.

courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Genetic Engineering
courses.description: The course will provide an extended understanding on the basic concepts, applications, and strategies of genetic engineering. Contents include a comprehensive introduction of recombinant DNA technology, selected techniques for genomic and functional genomic studies, and an overview on organism cloning and transgenic organisms.
courses.course_syllabus:
How gene works: a brief revision
Basic concepts of gene cloning
Hybridization and blotting
Screening and construction of gene libraries
DNA sequencing
Application of PCR
Functional genomics
Organism cloning and transgenic organisms
基因是如何作用的: 簡要回顧
基因複製的基本概念
分子雜交與印迹
基因文庫的建構及篩選
基因測序
聚合酶連鎖反應的應用
基因組功能研究
生物複製與轉基因生物
courses.feedback_evaluation:
Course questionnaire will be conduced every time when the course is run.
Qualitative feedback from the student panels will be sought, via formal staff-student consultation committee meetings or informal interactions between teachers and students.
If a problem is spotted, teachers will give their reflections, including evidence from the assessment.
 本科每課都設有課程調查問卷。
 通過正式的師生諮詢委員會會議或非正式師生互動獲得學生對課程的反饋。
 如出現爭議，本科教授會作出檢示（包括從評估得到的依據）。
courses.required_readings: n.a.
courses.recommended_readings:
“Gene Cloning and DNA Analysis: an Introduction” 5/e by Brown
“Recombinant DNA” 3/e by Wason et al.
“Principles of Gene Manipulation” 7/e by Primrose and Twyman

courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Plant Biotechnology

meetings.instructor:
Professor KANG Byung Ho, 
Professor ZHONG Silin

Professor KANG Byung Ho, 
Professor ZHONG Silin

Professor KANG Byung Ho, 
Professor ZHONG Silin

courses.description: This course is to prepare students with interests in higher level molecular biology based plant biotechnology. Students enrolled in this course will study the principles of traditional breeding from the molecular biological perspectives; gene discovery by forward and reverse genetics with emphasis on T-DNA and transposons and their application in functional genomics; principles and applications of plant genomics and epigenomics; transgenic technology with detailed discussion on current development of marker-free, gene silencing and RNA interference, and gene stackediting technologies; and application of plant biotechnology with reference to actual examples and relevant industrial perspectives. In addition, food and environmental safety concerns related to genetically-modified crops will be discussed.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Knowledge outcomes:

1. Acquire ability to comprehend the implication and application of genetic concepts in plant biotechnology;
2. Acquire core knowledge on transgenic technologies related to plant biotechnology, with more detailed knowledge on new techniques such as marker-free, gene silencing and RNA interference, and gene editing;
3. Acquire knowledge on potential applications of plant biotechnology;
4. Acquire an educated understanding on the industrial prospective and safety concerns of plant biotechnology.

Skills outcomes:

5. Acquire skills in literature survey using various sources including effective usage of information technologies and web-based searches;
6. Acquire good analytical and oral communication skills via class project presentation;
7. Acquire good problem solving skill via course assessment.

Values and attribute outcomes:

8. Acquire a positive attitude toward plant biotechnology;
9. Acquire an educated mind and responsible attitude to judge the pros and cons of various applications of plant biotechnology to the human society and natural environment.

知識成果：
1. 獲得深入理解遺傳學原理在植物生物技術中的內涵及其應用的能力；

2. 獲得植物生物技術相關轉基因技術的核心知識，包括新技術的深入探討，如無標記轉基因技術，基因沉默，RNA幹擾和基因编辑等；

3. 獲得植物生物技術應用前景的知識；

4. 獲得對植物生物技術的工業前景及有關此技術安全問題的深入理解。

技能成果:

5. 獲得利用不同資源搜尋文獻的技能，包括有效的利用資訊技術和網頁搜尋；

6. 過課程專案報告，獲得良好的分析和口頭表達的技能；

7. 通過課程考核，獲得良好的解決問題的技能。

價值觀和屬性成果：
8. 獲得對植物生物技術的積極態度；

9. 獲得以知識的思考和負責任的態度去判斷植物生物技術的各種應用對人類社會和自然環境的利與弊。
courses.course_syllabus:
Overview and the need of plant biotechnology

Introduction to crop breeding and molecular genetics

Domestication and molecular breeding of crops

Forward genetics

Reverse genetics

Mutagenesis: Transposons, T-DNA and others

Application of molecular genetics in plant biotechnology

General principle of transgenic technology

Mark-free technology

Gene silencing and RNAi

Gene editing

Applications in plant biotechnology

Plant hormones and plant biotechnology

Industrial prospective of plant biotechnology: a case study of the Monsanto Company

Safety issues of transgenic technology

The benefits and risks of GMO; Plant genomics; Plant epigenetics; Plant Epigenomics.

植物生物技術概論及需求
作物育種及分子遺傳學簡介
作物馴化及分子育種
正向遺傳學
反向遺傳學
轉座子及T-DNA的誘導突變

分子遺傳學在植物生物技術中的應用
轉基因技術概論
無標記轉基因技術
基因沉默和RNA幹擾

基因编辑的基本理論及其應用
植物激素与植物生物技術
植物生物技術工業中的应用前景
Monsanto公司案例學習

轉基因技術的安全問題
基因改良产物的益処与凨险；植物基因组學；植物表覌遗传學；植物表覌基因组學

courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Animal Biotechnology
courses.description: This course will cover the developments and applications of transgenic animals including mice, cattle, sheep, goats, pigs, birds and fish. Topics concerning human gene mapping and isolation and somatic cell gene therapy will also be covered.
courses.learning_outcomes:
- to understand the methodology of transgenic animals and their applications

- to appreciate how genome sequencing works

- to learn how to find the gene responsible for a genetic disease

- to understand and apply the methodology of detecting mutations in disease genes

- to understand the principles and development of antibody production and antibody engineering

- to understand the implications of genome projects to the development of the field of animal biotechnology

- to understand the principles of gene therapy

理解動物基因轉殖技術
如何欣賞全基因組測序工程
學習如何找到遺傳性疾病基因
理解和運用檢測基因突變的方法
理解抗體生產和抗體工程的原理和發展
了解基因組對動物生物技術領域發展的影響
了解基因治療的原理
courses.course_syllabus:
Transgenesis

Monoclonal antibodies and antibody engineering

Gene therapy

Animal models of human diseases

動物基因轉殖技術
單株抗體及抗體蛋白質工程
基因療法
人類疾病之動物模式
courses.feedback_evaluation:
Course Questionaire

Reflection of teachers

Qualitative feedback from student panels

教師反思
課程問卷
學生意見書定性反饋

Glick and Pasternak (2003) Molecular Biotechnology - Principles and Applications of Recombinant DNA. 3rd Ed, ASM Press

Strachan & Read (2004) Human Molecular Genetics. 3rd Ed, Garland Science.

courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Microbial Biotechnology

meetings.instructor:
Professor CHAN Michael Kenneth, 
Professor WANG Guanqun, 
Professor WONG Kam Bo

Professor CHAN Michael Kenneth, 
Professor WANG Guanqun, 
Professor WONG Kam Bo

Professor CHAN Michael Kenneth, 
Professor WANG Guanqun, 
Professor WONG Kam Bo

courses.description: Knowledge in microbial technology is growing exponentially throughout the discovery of novel sequences of hundreds of microorganisms and the advancement of new technologies, such as genomics, transcriptomics, proteomics and metabolomics. This course examines the application of the latest technologies in microbial biotechnology to environment, agriculture, industry and medicine. Selected topics include applied microbial physiology; genetic engineering; genomics and proteomics; metabolomics and biosynthetic pathway analysis and industrial fermentation technology. Examples of applications include microbial production of single-cell proteins, protein engineering, primary and secondary metabolites. Plant/animal – microbe interactions and microbial technology in biocatalysis, biodegradation and bioremediation will also be discussed. Two project orientated laboratory sections will also be included. Students will gain hands-on experience on conducting latest microbial biotechnology researches.
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. Critical thinking in solving microbial biotechnology related problems
2. Learn and aware of the latest technology of microbial technology in the industry

1. Able to perform independent research and evaluation on assigned fermentation and bioremediation projects

4. Understand the logistics of downstream processing of biotechnology product

通过本课程的学习，同学们将掌握以下技能：
1. 运用辩证思维思考微生物学技术在其相关领域的应用问题。
2. 学习并关注工业领域最近使用的相关微生物技术的应用情况。
3. 具备独立研究的技能，并能合理评判特定发酵工程的状况。
4. 理解生物技术产物的下游处理流程。
courses.course_syllabus:
Overview and Introduction to Microbial diversity
Bioreactor design, concept, formulation and calculations
Fermentation methodologies and downstream processes
Microbial and Viral Genetics
Applications on Industrial Enzymes
Spectives on other Biotechnological products
Microbial Biotechnology on environmental application
Water treatment and Social issues will be discussed
Selected Biotechnology Company visit will also be arranged (e.g.CK Life Sciences Ltd. H.K.)
探討微生物多样性综述
生物反应器设计、概念、公式、计算
发酵方法与流程
微生物和病毒遗传学应用
工业用酶和其他生物技术产品的产业远景
討論环保及应用水处理和相關社会问题
水处理和社会问题
本科亦會安排介绍本地生物技术公司（例如: 香港长江生命科技集团有限公司）

1)Course Questionnaire
2)Reflection of teachers
3)Qualitative feedback from student panels

2. 教师教学反思。
3. 学生渠道的定性回馈。
courses.required_readings:
Text Book
Microbial Biotechnology, Fundamentals of Applied Microbiology 2nd Edition (2007), Alexander N. Glazer & Hiroshi Nikaido, Cambridge University Press

Fundamentals of Applied Microbiology
Understanding Biotechnology (2003), Aluizio Borem, Fabricio R. Santos and David E Bowen Prentice Hall, Pearson Education Inc.
Understanding Biotechnology An Integrated and Cyber-based Approach (2003), George Acquaah Prentice Hall, Pearson Education Inc.
Essential I Genetics (2003), Peter J. Russell Benjamin Cummings, Pearson Education Inc.

Fermentation
Principles of fermentation technology, 2nd ed., Stanbury, P.F., Whitaker, A. and Hall, S.J. (TP156.F4 S7 1995) (Reserve)
Enzyme biotechnology: protein engineering, structure prediction and fermentation. Edited by James, M. and Crabbe, C. (TP248.65.E59 E59 1990) (Reserve)
Mammalian cell biotechnology in protein production. Edited by Hauser, H. and Wagner, R. (TP246.65.P76 M36 1997)
Biotechnological applications of plant cultures. Edited by Shargool, P.D. and Ngo, T.T. (TP248.27.P55B585 1994) (Reserve)

Protein engineering
Ling, M.M. and Robinson, B.H. 1997. Approaches to DNA mutagenesis: an overview. Anal. Biochem. 254:157-178.
Wells, J.A. and Estell, D.A. 1988. Subtilisin - an enzyme designed to be engineered. TIBS 13:291-297.
von der Osten, C. et al. 1993. Protein engineering of subtilisins to improve stability in detergent formulations. J. Biotechnol. 28:55-68
Zhao, H. and Arnold, F.H. 1999. Directed evolution converts subtilisin E into a functional equivalent of thermitase. Protein Eng. 12:47-53.
Verstraete, M. 2000. Third-generation thrombolytic drugs. Am. J. Med. 109:52-58.
Vajo, Z. and Duckworth, W.C. 2000. Genetically engineered insulin analogs: diabetes in the new millennium. Pharmacol. Rev. 52:1-9

Industrial practice
Biopharmaceutical process validation, Sofer, G. and Zabriskie, D.W. (QV38.B5526 2000)
Cleanroom design, 2nd ed., Whyte, W. (TH7694.C54 1999)
Guideline of general principles of process validation (May 1987, originally published by CDER, CBER, and CDRH and presently recognized by CDER, CBER, and CVM). (http://www.fda.gov/cder/guidance/pv.htm)
Australian code of good manufacturing practice for medical products, Aug. 16, 2002, Therapeutic goods administration. (www.tga.gov.au)
Cleanrooms and associated controlled environments, ISO 14644 standards and IEST technical guides to the ISO standards. (www.iest.org)

PAT
US FDA, guidance for industry PAT - a framework for innovative. Pharmaceutical development, manufacturing, and quality assurance, Sept. 2004. (http://www.fda.gov/Cder/guidance/6419fnl.htm)

courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Senior Experimental Project I
courses.description: In this course, students will undertake an experimental project of molecular biotechnology under the supervision of a teaching staff. To fulfill the course requirement, students are required to discuss their progress with their supervisors regularly and complete a written report related to the experimental findings.
courses.learning_outcomes:
The student will develop the following abilities:

• Critical thinking on scientific information

• Hands-on abilities in conducting experiments related to molecular biotechnology

• Report writing skills

• Acquire a positive attitude toward genetic engineering

• Acquire an educated mind and responsible attitude to judge the pros and cons of various applications of genetic engineering to the human society and natural environment.

學生將會發展以下能力：
• 對科學資訊的批判性思維
• 分子生物技術實驗的操作能力
• 報告書寫能力
• 獲得對分子生物技術的積極態度
• 獲得以知識的思考和負責任的態度去判斷植物生物技術的各種應用對人類社會和自然環境的利與弊。
courses.course_syllabus:
It is a project-based course. There is no specific syllabus while the students are expected to take initiative.

這是一門基於專案的課程。這門以學生為主導的課程並沒有特定的教學大綱。
courses.feedback_evaluation:
- Immediate feedback will be obtained by the close and regular contact between students and their supervisors.

- The course coordinator and programme director will meet with students who encounter specific problems in their progress.

- An open discussion session will follow the oral presentations of the students. They are encouraged to give feedback of the course.

- Qualitative feedback from the student panels will be sought, via formal staff-student consultation committee meetings or informal interactions between teachers and students.

- 通過學生和指導教師密切和定期的接觸，將會得到即時的回饋。

- 與學科負責人和課程主任將會會見那些在進展中遇到具體問題的學生。

- 學生完成口頭報告以後會有一個公開的討論會，我們鼓勵學生門給予課程回饋。

- 通過正式的師生諮詢委員會會議或者非正式的教師和學生間的互動，將會收集學生方面的定性的回饋。
courses.required_readings: A suitable reading list will be determined by the students and their supervisors.
courses.recommended_readings: A suitable reading list will be determined by the students and their supervisors.

courses.description: Each senior student in the programme will undertake a biotechnology research project at the beginning of the final year under the supervision of a teaching staff. In the first term, each student will prepare a project proposal and present a seminar (on literature review and methods/approaches). The experiment will run during the final year. The research project will be completed before graduation with a written report and a seminar presentation.
courses.learning_outcomes:
The student will develop the following abilities:

• Critical thinking on scientific information

• Hands-on abilities in conducting experiments related to molecular biotechnology

• Report writing skills

• Acquire a positive attitude toward genetic engineering

• Acquire an educated mind and responsible attitude to judge the pros and cons of various applications of genetic engineering to the human society and natural environment.

學生將會發展以下能力：
• 對科學資訊的批判性思維
• 分子生物技術實驗的操作能力
• 報告書寫能力
• 獲得對分子生物技術的積極態度
• 獲得以知識的思考和負責任的態度去判斷植物生物技術的各種應用對人類社會和自然環境的利與弊。

学生将会发展以下能力：
• 对科学资讯的批判性思维
• 分子生物技术实验的操作能力
• 报告书写能力
• 获得对分子生物技术的积极态度
• 获得以知识的思考和负责任的态度去判断植物生物技术的各种应用对人类社会和自然环境的利与弊。
courses.course_syllabus:
It is a project-based course. There is no specific syllabus while the students are expected to take initiative.

- The course coordinator and programme director will meet with students who encounter specific problems in their progress.

- An open discussion session will follow the oral presentations of the students. They are encouraged to give feedback of the course.

- Qualitative feedback from the student panels will be sought, via formal staff-student consultation committee meetings or informal interactions between teachers and students.

- 通過學生和指導教師密切和定期的接觸，將會得到即時的回饋。

- 與學科負責人和課程主任將會會見那些在進展中遇到具體問題的學生。

- 學生完成口頭報告以後會有一個公開的討論會，我們鼓勵學生們給予課程回饋。

- 通過正式的師生諮詢委員會會議或者非正式的教師和學生間的互動，將會收集學生方面的定性的回饋。

- 通过学生和指导教师密切和定期的接触，将会得到即时的回馈。

- 与学科负责人和课程主任将会会见那些在进展中遇到具体问题的学生。

- 学生完成口头报告以后会有一个公开的讨论会，我们鼓励学生们给予课程回馈。

- 通过正式的师生咨询委员会会议或者非正式的教师和学生间的互动，将会收集学生方面的定性的回馈。
courses.required_readings: A suitable reading list will be determined by the students and their supervisors.
courses.recommended_readings: A suitable reading list will be determined by the students and their supervisors.

courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Senior Experimental Project III

meetings.instructor:
Professor CHAN Ho Yin Edwin, 
Professor CHAN Ting Fung Philos, 
Professor CHEN Sijie, 
Professor HUI Jerome Ho Lam, 
Professor KWAN Kin Ming, 
Professor LAM Hon Ming, 
Professor LI Cheng, 
Professor LO Kwok Wai, 
Professor SHAW Pang Chui, 
Professor TSANG Ling Ming, 
Professor WONG Kam Bo

courses.description: Each senior student in the programme will undertake a biotechnology research project at the beginning of the final year under the supervision of a teaching staff. In the first term, each student will prepare a project proposal and present a seminar (on literature review and methods/approaches). The experiment will run during the final year. The research project will be completed before graduation with a written report and a seminar presentation.
courses.learning_outcomes:
The student will develop the following abilities:

• Critical thinking on scientific information

• Hands-on abilities in conducting experiments related to molecular biotechnology

• Report writing skills

• Acquire a positive attitude toward genetic engineering

• Acquire an educated mind and responsible attitude to judge the pros and cons of various applications of genetic engineering to the human society and natural environment.

學生將會發展以下能力：
• 對科學資訊的批判性思維
• 分子生物技術實驗的操作能力
• 報告書寫能力
• 獲得對分子生物技術的積極態度
• 獲得以知識的思考和負責任的態度去判斷植物生物技術的各種應用對人類社會和自然環境的利與弊。

学生将会发展以下能力：
• 对科学资讯的批判性思维
• 分子生物技术实验的操作能力
• 报告书写能力
• 获得对分子生物技术的积极态度
• 获得以知识的思考和负责任的态度去判断植物生物技术的各种应用对人类社会和自然环境的利与弊。
courses.course_syllabus:
It is a project-based course. There is no specific syllabus while the students are expected to take initiative.

這是一門基於專案的課程。這門以學生為主導的課程並沒有特定的教學大綱。
这是一门基于专案的课程。这门以学生为主导的课程并没有特定的教学大纲。

- Immediate feedback will be obtained by the close and regular contact between students and their supervisors.

- 學生完成口頭報告以後會有一個公開的討論會，我們鼓勵學生們給予課程回饋。

- 通過正式的師生諮詢委員會會議或者非正式的教師和學生間的互動，將會收集學生方面的定性的回饋。

courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Internship
courses.description: In this course, students will undertake a summer experimental project of molecular biotechnology in a local or overseas laboratory/ institution/ company). To fulfill the course requirement, students are required to discuss their progress with their supervisors regularly. Upon the request of the supervisor, student may give a seminar presentation and complete a written report related to the experimental findings.
courses.learning_outcomes:
The student will develop the following abilities:

• Critical thinking on scientific information.

• Hands-on abilities in conducting experiments related to molecular biotechnology.

• Acquire a positive attitude toward molecular biotechnology.

• Acquire an educated mind and responsible attitude to judge the pros and cons of various applications of genetic engineering to the human society and natural environment.

courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Seminar
courses.description: Students are required to present the results of their research to their peers and staff.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MPhil-PhD Molecular Biotechnology
courses.learning_outcomes:
After finishing the course, students should be able to
(1) acquire core knowledge in molecular biotechnology and in-depth knowledge in a particular field of molecular and biotechnological sciences for research.
(2) acquire life-long learning skills to be an independent researcher.
(3) acquire knowledge to plan research work.
(4) acquire generic skills such as analytical skills, communication skills and writing skills.
(5) acquire skills how to prepare manuscript for publication.
courses.course_syllabus:
- Life Sciences Seminar Series

- Graduate Seminar
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Discussion with students

2. Self-reflection of teacher(s)

3. Feedback from alumni

4. Feedback from Visiting Committee and regular programme reviews
courses.required_readings: Journal articles and other research materials assigned by individual supervisors.
courses.recommended_readings: Additional journal articles and other research materials recommended by individual supervisors.

courses.subject: MBTE
courses.title: Thesis Research
courses.description: In this course, a student is required to meet with his/her supervisor regularly who provides necessary guidance and supervision to write up a thesis and monitors the student's academic progress.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MPhil-PhD Molecular Biotechnology
courses.learning_outcomes: Development of research skills, including field and/or laboratory studies and data analysis as related to the students' thesis research.
courses.course_syllabus:
- Identify a research topic

- Develop a research hypothesis

- Prepare a research proposal

- Develop research methodology and experimental design

- Conduct an original *research* with impact in a specific field or subject

- Analyze experimental results and make appropriate data interpretation

- Prepare a research dissertation/thesis and related manuscripts for publication
courses.feedback_evaluation:
1. Discussion with students

2. Self-reflection of teacher(s)

3. Feedback from alumni

4. Feedback from Visiting Committee and regular programme reviews
courses.required_readings: Journal articles and other research materials assigned by individual supervisors.
courses.recommended_readings: Additional journal articles and other research materials recommended by individual supervisors.
